body.p: Management should explain how and why the performance of the entity is short of, meets or exceeds forward‑looking disclosures made in the prior period management commentary. For example, if management stated targets for future performance in previous reporting periods, it should report the entity’s actual performance in the current reporting period and analyse and explain significant variances from its previously stated targets as well as the implications of those variances for management’s expectations for the entity’s future performance.
